Package src.tictactoe.util

Class ComputerLogic

java.lang.Object
src.tictactoe.util.ComputerLogic
public class ComputerLogic
extends java.lang.Object
ComputerLogic class contains all the code that's being used to prevent player from winning This class has several methods that are used by one single method that is called in the main class of this app I wanted to avoid having several different methods being called in the main.
Author:
Mika Kivennen√§

  • Constructor Details

    • ComputerLogic

  • Method Details

    • placeMark

      public java.lang.String[][] placeMark​(java.lang.String[][] arrayToCheck, java.lang.String playerMark, java.lang.String computerMark, java.lang.String emptyMark, int requiredAmount)
      placeMark method places computer mark to a slot determined by multiple methods. This class has multiple methods to check the arrays if player has a chance to win. This placeMark method tries to run each of the methods to go through array as long as it has not placed it's own mark down yet.
      Parameters:
      arrayToCheck - is the array that is being inspected
      playerMark - is the player mark that computer is trying to prevent from winning
      computerMark - is the computers mark that is being placed after this method has run
      emptyMark - is the empty mark that allows computer to place it's mark
      requiredAmount - is the amount needed for a win. This is used to calculate different positions for mark
      Returns:
      returns a 2D-array that acts as the gameboard

    • markRow

      public static java.lang.String[][] markRow​(java.lang.String[][] arrayToCheck, java.lang.String playerMark, java.lang.String computerMark, java.lang.String emptyMark, int requiredAmount)
      markRow method places computer mark if there's a chance for player to win. This method places a computer mark on a horizontal line to block the player from winning if there's a need for it. Goes through each row and calculates if player has half or more marks in a row from the required amount then places a mark trying to prevent player from having a clear chance to win.
      Parameters:
      arrayToCheck - is the array that is being inspected
      playerMark - is human player mark that computer is trying to prevent from winning
      computerMark - is the computers mark that is being placed after this method has run
      emptyMark - is the empty mark that allows computer to place it's mark
      requiredAmount - is the amount needed for a win. This is used to calculate different positions for mark
      Returns:
      returns a 2D-array that acts as the gameboard

    • markColumn

      public static java.lang.String[][] markColumn​(java.lang.String[][] arrayToCheck, java.lang.String playerMark, java.lang.String computerMark, java.lang.String emptyMark, int requiredAmount)
      markColumn method places computer mark if there's a chance for player to win. This method places a computer mark on a vertical line to block the player from winning if there's a need for it. Goes through each column and calculates if player has half or more marks in a row from the required amount then places a mark trying to prevent player from having a clear chance to win.
      Parameters:
      arrayToCheck - is the array that is being inspected
      playerMark - is human player mark that computer is trying to prevent from winning
      computerMark - is the computers mark that is being placed after this method has run
      emptyMark - is the empty mark that allows computer to place it's mark
      requiredAmount - is the amount needed for a win. This is used to calculate different positions for mark
      Returns:
      returns a 2D-array that acts as the gameboard

    • markDiagonalTopLeft

      public static java.lang.String[][] markDiagonalTopLeft​(java.lang.String[][] arrayToCheck, java.lang.String playerMark, java.lang.String computerMark, java.lang.String emptyMark, int requiredAmount)
      markDiagonalTopLeft method places computer mark if there's a chance for player to win. This method places a computer mark on a diagonal line to block the player from winning if there's a need for it. Goes through each diagonal line and calculates if player has half or more marks in a row from the required amount then places a mark trying to prevent player from having a clear chance to win.
      Parameters:
      arrayToCheck - is the array that is being inspected
      playerMark - is human player mark that computer is trying to prevent from winning
      computerMark - is the computers mark that is being placed after this method has run
      emptyMark - is the empty mark that allows computer to place it's mark
      requiredAmount - is the amount needed for a win. This is used to calculate different positions for mark
      Returns:
      returns a 2D-array that acts as the gameboard

    • markDiagonalBotLeft

      public static java.lang.String[][] markDiagonalBotLeft​(java.lang.String[][] arrayToCheck, java.lang.String playerMark, java.lang.String computerMark, java.lang.String emptyMark, int requiredAmount)
      markDiagonalBotLeft method places computer mark if there's a chance for player to win. This method places computer mark after going through diagonal lines from bottom left to top right corner if there is a need for one.
      Parameters:
      arrayToCheck - is the array that is being inspected
      playerMark - is human player mark that computer is trying to prevent from winning
      computerMark - is the computers mark that is being placed after this method has run
      emptyMark - is the empty mark that allows computer to place it's mark
      requiredAmount - is the amount needed for a win. This is used to calculate different positions for mark
      Returns:
      returns a 2D-array that acts as the gameboard

    • randomizeSlot

      public static java.lang.String[][] randomizeSlot​(java.lang.String[][] arrayToCheck, java.lang.String playerMark, java.lang.String computerMark, java.lang.String emptyMark)
      randomizeSlot method places computer mark to a randomly assigned slot. This method places to computer mark to a randomly decided slot if it hasn't detected player being close to winning.
      Parameters:
      arrayToCheck - is the array that is being inspected
      playerMark - is human player mark that computer is trying to prevent from winning
      computerMark - is the computers mark that is being placed after this method has run
      emptyMark - is the empty mark that allows computer to place it's mark
      Returns:
      returns a 2D-array that acts as the gameboard

    • tryToWin

      public static java.lang.String[][] tryToWin​(java.lang.String[][] arrayToCheck, java.lang.String playerMark, java.lang.String computerMark, java.lang.String emptyMark, int requiredAmount)
      tryToWin method calculates if the computer is close to winning horizontally or vertically and then places it's mark if it can win. This method places to computer mark to a randomly decided slot if it hasn't detected player being close to winning.
      Parameters:
      arrayToCheck - is the array that is being inspected
      playerMark - is human player mark that computer is trying to prevent from winning
      computerMark - is the computers mark that is being placed after this method has run
      emptyMark - is the empty mark that allows computer to place it's mark
      requiredAmount - is the amount needed for a win. This is used to calculate different positions for mark
      Returns:
      returns a 2D-array that acts as the gameboard
